attributes.action: help in the retention of the Fampoux Memorial Gardens situated in the area of Winton East, in memory of those who lost their lives in the Battle of Fampoux 1917
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Fampoux Memorial Gardens and Stone was build, erected and laid by members of the Hampshire Regiment in 1922,who survived the Battle of Fampoux, Nord Pas de Calais in 1917. Besides the cemetary in Fampoux France, this Memorial Garden is the only place of remembrance. Now under the Bournemouth Council Chiefs directive of Parks and Playground Management, they wish to remove, desecrate this area, for the purpose of 11 dwellings, unwanted flat dwellings. The Management directive indicates Play parks and playgrounds, which the Fampoux Memorial Garden is neither. Your support in the saving of this wonderful garden in memory of fallen heroes will be appreciated. Please sign the petition against the go ahead by Bournemouth Council Chiefs to rid us of the Fampoux Memorial Gardens.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
